fields.description:
From the SourceTree menu, I checked the appearance > use MacOS System appearance.

And my MacOS is dynamic appearance.

If I turn off my computer after dark mode and turn on my computer at light mode, MacOS is in light mode, but SourceTre is still in dark mode.

If I use it in light mode and it changes to dark mode in real time, the SourceTree appearance changes well. However, if I shut down the computer and turn it back on, even if it is in light mode, it will be in dark mode.

Please solve it.
fields.summary: It did not change the appearance.

fields.description: I would like to have the option to see unpushed changes in [the apps notification dot|[https://d.pr/free/i/qBQt14]. |https://d.pr/free/i/qBQt14].]That would be an easy way to prevent user from forgetting to push.
fields.summary: Show unpushed changes in red notification dot on Mac

fields.description:
today I need to handle pull requests through the web. 

I have no indication in sourcetree. 

more over I would like to use the diff tool I defined in sourcetree to see diffs or better use another 3rd part for code review it. 

 

hope you will add this soon.
fields.summary: add pull request indication to sourcetree

fields.description:
Currently file lists have "Copy Path To Clipboard" popup menu item, most of the time I only need the file name.

Please add "Copy File Name To Clipboard" menu item or change "Copy Path To Clipboard" menu item to "Copy File Name To Clipboard" when e.g. option/alt is pressed.
fields.summary: Copy File Name To Clipboard

fields.description: When attempting to use drag + drop to re-order bookmarks, Sourcetree immediately crashes. I'm running macOS 10.15.2 and Sourcetree v4 (229).
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes when attempting to drag + drop bookmarks

fields.description:
When I click the "Terminal" toolbar button, it opens Terminal, but doesn't set the current directory to my git repository.

My guess is this is related to Catalina's new permissions management that doesn't let SourceTree control other applications, but can't find a way to give SourceTree these permissions.
fields.summary: Terminal toolbar button broken

fields.description:
Hi,

I noticed that the Mac OS 10.14 requirement for Source Tree 3.2 is not mentioned into the release note. I can see the 10.13 requirement for 3.0, but that's all.
fields.summary: Mac OS 10.14 requirement not mentioned in release notes

fields.description:
OS 10.15.2

iTerm 3.3.7

SourceTree 4.0 (232)

Preferences: Terminal App: iTerm2

When clicking on "Terminal" in the upper right corner of an open repo, the app iTerm2 starts but no terminal window is shown.

However, SourceTree shows an error dialog: There was an error opening the repository in iTerm2.

 

When I open the AppleScript in the script editor and run it, an new terminal window is shown. However, then I get the following error message: 

cd 'ST_REPO_PATH'
-bash: cd: ST_REPO_PATH: No such file or directory

!image-2019-12-28-14-34-32-051.png!
fields.summary: Error Dialog Box appears when using iTerm2 as Terminal application

fields.description:
When i try to add a second account for a second server using the same username, the second one cannot save the credentials. I only tested it so far, that i allways have problems with the second account added to the server accounts. Also gitlab interface does not handle this nicely, the accounts are not distinguisable in the accounts tab (only username shown), also in the overview it will list the repositories of both servers under the same hierarchy.

Likely steps to reproduce:
 * have 2 gitlab ce servers with the same username
 * add both gitlab ce accounts with the personal access token
 * quit sourcetree
 * restart sourcetree and go into the remote tab

The problem is more problematic because it requires to generate a new access token all the time, gitlab ce does not allow to view the token again, and storing it locally is not really advisable.
fields.summary: Cannot handle multiple Gitlab CE with same username

fields.description:
latest 4.0 Sourcetree.  brand new 16" mbp so 10.15.2 (19C57)
 # have some items in "pending files", say three items
 # try to "drag" one of the items (pretend it's possible to rearrange the order)

instant full crash
fields.summary: obvious, simple bug

fields.description: - Without focusing on any file if you press space all files get hidden
fields.summary: Files on stage gets hidden

fields.description:
При горизонтальном положении экрана, пропадает вид приложения и появляется текст: "У вас нет актуальных билетов" "Поверните ваше устройство вертикально для работы с приложением"

!image-2019-12-21-17-57-15-407.png|width=331,height=186!
fields.summary: Горизонтальное положение экрана

fields.description: User cannot collapse files and it's really difficult if the files are huge. It will be much better if user have option to collapse the files.
fields.summary: Cannot collapse / expand files

fields.description:
In "all branches" mode, branches displayed as detached state, as if they are dedicated branch.

But in the "current branch" mode, it's ok.

!image-2019-12-19-15-57-09-951.png!

!image-2019-12-19-15-56-56-981.png!

!image-2019-12-19-15-56-13-259.png!
fields.summary: All branches graph display error

fields.description:
recently updated to a new 16" MacBook Pro with macOS Catalina. On the new machine, I've set the diff integration to Araxis Merge. When I run an external diff, Araxis Merge will launch, but does not open any files.

I noticed that when I ran the Araxis Merge "compare" command line tool from iTerm2, macOS asked for permission to allow iTerm2 to control Araxis Merge and this can be seen in System Preferences / Security & Privacy / Privacy / Automation. Sourcetree did not ask for this permission.

Furthermore, attempting to run the external diff, yields this message in the macOS system log: "Refusing TCCAccessRequestIndirect for service kTCCServiceAppleEvents and client /Applications/Sourcetree.app[0] without NSAppleEventsUsageDescription key".
fields.summary: Araxis Merge integration not working.

fields.description: I recently updated to a new 16" MacBook Pro with macOS Catalina. On the new machine, when I set a commit message template in the preferences, it does not take effect (starting a new commit begins with an empty message). If I quit and restart Sourcetree, the commit template is no longer shown in the preferences.
fields.summary: Commit message template not working

fields.description:
I have selected "auto" option in macOS general appearance prefpane.

I had SourceTree 3.2 set to dark mode. After upgrade to 4.0 the SourceTree still stays in dark mode. After opening preferences and selecting "Use macOS system appearance" it still stays in dark mode. Switching to light mode works properly, but changing back to "Use macOS system appearance" windows become dark even though all other windows in macOS use light scheme.
fields.summary: Automatic theme switching doesn't work

fields.description:
In our repository we use Git Tags to tag which code is deployed on specific environment (TEST, UAT, PROD).

Whenever we make another deployment on enviroment we use the same Tag name (basically this means that old tag is deleted and new is created on different commit). 

 

If another developer wants to refresh the tags, he uses Fetch / Fetch all tags using Sourcetree.

!image-2019-12-16-16-14-26-979.png!

 

Since tag has the same name we get the following error:

!image-2019-12-16-16-19-26-491.png!

"_git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks fetch --prune --tags origin_
_From https://dev.azure.com/GeniDevOps/Integrations/_git/NeuronEsbSales_
 _! [rejected] TEST-Sales -> TEST-Sales (would clobber existing tag)_

_Completed with errors, see above._"

 

Doing some research we found out that as of Git 2.2.0 you need to explicitly specify the force flag:

{{git fetch origin --tags --force}}

source: [https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9662249/how-to-overwrite-local-tags-with-git-fetch/21475727]

 

Can you please add this option to force fatching the tags to Sourcetree?
fields.summary: Add option to force fetching of tags with the same name

fields.description:
*Symptom and reproduce procedures*

Sourcetree would break right after Homebrew, the mac package manager, updates git. It's exactly the same as in the [community question|[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Git-questions/HomeBrew-Git-update-always-breaks-SourceTree/qaq-p/594649]].
fields.summary: HomeBrew Git update always breaks SourceTree

fields.description:
This happens right after entering authentication code validation.

!image-2019-12-14-08-26-50-981.png!
fields.summary: Adding github account stuck on white page

fields.description:
Version 4.0 (232) appears to have had a regression to bug SRCTREE-5583 (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-5583)

When I attempt to log or annotate .gitignore files in sub-folders, I get a popup with the error message:

    *Potential security issue detected in the specified URL.*
    Sourcetree determined this URL is in an unsupported format.

I can only replicate this problem with hidden files in sub-folders. Hidden files in the root folder of the project work fine. This is inhibiting my ability to perform my work duties.
fields.summary: "Log Selected" on files beginning with . in subfolders results in unsupported URL format error

fields.description:
Hello,

I had a strange issue when I use sourcetree : my account was not accepted to connect to our Bitbucket server but my co-worker had no problem. Both account are configure the same way.

Here is the screen capture:

!image-2019-12-12-15-21-32-692.png!

But I've no problem to browse Bitbucket with a web browser !

When I investigate, I find that it's my password which create the issue. My password contains a "é" character and when I remove it, everything works well. But with the "é", the authentication failed !

Could you check this issue ?

Best regards
fields.summary: Unable to connect to bitbucket server

fields.description: Just like we have push option, it would be useful for a --no-verify option when committing. There are open source project with pretty extensive testing on commit. Not being able to skip them when doing house keeping is frustrating and doing house keeping from the terminal is error prone.
fields.summary: Add --no-verify option when committing

fields.description: The bitbucket-pipeline support on Mac version sourcetree is making CPU usage to sky rocket doing nothing, since you guys haven't had a clue on how to fix it for over a year, please  just give us a check box to disable pipeline support on Mac.
fields.summary: Option to disable Pipeline support for Mac users

fields.description: I used to drag folders from Finder onto the Sourcetree icon in order to open the git repository. However since version 4.0 this doesn't seem to work anymore.
fields.summary: Dragging a folder onto the app icon doesn't work anymore

fields.description: Installation Preferences don't allow you to tab between fields. !EKbEZNOUUAAElbj.png!
fields.summary: Unable to tab to next field in Installation Preferences

fields.description:
If you've never SSH'd in to a server, you can't clone a repository from it.
 # Add a new Bitbucket Server or Github Enterprise account using a personal access token.
 # Set the account's Protocol to SSH and make sure your SSH Key is set up properly.
 # Window > Show Remote Hosted Repositories
 # Click the Clone button on a repository that shows up.

Sourcetree churns for a long time, then attempts to clone the repository using Mercurial which fails since it's a Git server. The (IMO unintuitive) workaround is this.
 # Copy the Source URL out of Sourcetree.
 # In Terminal do `git clone <ssh url>`
 # Trust the server's SSH key.
fields.summary: Sourcetree can't clone repositories until the server SSH key has been trusted externally

fields.description:
I can't stay logged in to multiple accounts at once. It appears that only the first Basic authentication account can be saved. All subsequent accounts lose their password on quit and relaunch.
 # Launch Sourcetree for the first time and add a Bitbucket Server account with your Personal Access Token.
 # Add a GitHub Enterprise account with your Personal Access Token for that system.
 # Quit and relaunch Sourcetree.
 # Show the remote hosted repositories.

Sourcetree prompts you for the password to the Github Enterprise account. Entering the personal access token doesn't actually work, you have to go into Preferences and enter the password in the account tab, and then re-enter it to verify (I'm not sure why). Then the password sticks until you quit and relaunch again.
fields.summary: Only the first created account saves its password in Keychain

fields.description:
Hi,

With Sourcetree 4.0 (229) for Mac under Catalina, if you click a repository in the main window and move the mouse, just like a drag&drop of an item, Sourcetree immediately crashes.
fields.summary: Mouse move on repository leads to crash

fields.description:
When looking at History, switching between Uncommitted changes and any commit resets the size of the "Staged files" and "Unstaged files" windows, as well as the source code view.

 

Is there way to change this behavior, and I'm just missing it?

It is quite annoying when reviewing source code changes to constantly resize the source code window.
fields.summary: When changing the view, the size of child windows reverts to a default

fields.description:
I'm trying to do sub-feature branches on a feature branch using embedded git-flow and keep getting an error that the base "needs to be a branch. It does not exist and is required."

Prerequisities:

git-flow configured through Sourcetree.

Steps to reproduce:
 # make sure you are on a feature branch that has at least on commit (FC1)
 # tap "git-flow" button in the toolbar (it should offer to complete a feature)
 # Choose "Start Feature" from "other actions" drop down.
 # In opened dialog box select "Working copy revision" (which is FC1)
 # Type any feature name
 # Click "Ok"

The following error text is displayed in disclosed log text area:

{code}
git feature start presentation {FC1 sha} 
Fatal: Base '{FC1 sha}' needs to be a branch. It does not exist and is required.
Completed with errors, see above
{code}

Error can also be reproduced by selecting "Specified commit" and picking FC1 commit from the commit dialog box.

macOS: 10.15.1
system git: 2.21.0
embeded git: 2.20.1
fields.summary: Can't start feature branch off of another feature branch

fields.description:
When merging:

If i change to the commit tab quickly after clicking merge master into x branch,

the commit message isn't filled into the textarea automatically,

so i have i close the window and open it again to get it filled.

Just updated to 4.0, and the bug is still there.
fields.summary: Fix: merge commit msg not being filled if user is quick enough to change to the commit tab first

fields.description: When you are using Sourcetree in dark mode, the current branch is highlighted (bold) but not enough, and it is difficult to know which is the current branch. I suggest not only use a bold style, but using a different color.
fields.summary: Current branch not highlighted enough in dark mode

When changing the default "develop" branch to existing "development" in the SourceTree UI, it fails with the following error:

git init -d 
Using default branch names.

Which branch should be used for integration of the "next release"?

Branch name for "next release" development: [develop] 
Completed with errors, see above{noformat}
 

Screenshots:
Changing develop -> development
[https://screencast.com/t/L2H69wjyhx]
 
Trying to submit
[https://screencast.com/t/8tp2aTyQXuSG]

fields.description: I Can't log in from SourceTree.I am asked to fill in my password/i entered correct one but it still asking me a password ,so i cant pull updates from repository

1. Launching the Ukrainska Zaliznytsya application V1.23 on the Iphone 6S

When upgarde to Sourcetree 4.0, no matter 229 or 232, when you click the 'Terminal' button, it only bring up the terminal window, not going to the project folder

 

If there is no terminal, it simply launch terminal app, and stop at a path like

So thus preventing to create & organize by groups.

*SourceTree Version*: 4.0(229)

*Mac OS*: 10.15.1 with Supplemental Update (19B2106)

fields.description:
I uninstalled previous version of Sourcetree, as I got the problem with identification. When cloning a remote repo, I did a mistake in login. And Sourcetree was asking me a password for wrong login.
Then I downloaded app from the site and tried to install it.
get the following from my Mac:

"It is not possible to open Sourcetree file, as Apple cannot check it for harmful software.
Software needs update. Contact the developer for detailed information'
fields.summary: "Apple cannot check app for harmful software" - Sourcetree

fields.description: Wrong encoding in Mercurial:  !image-2019-11-22-12-20-20-745.png!
fields.summary: Wrong encoding

fields.description:
When creating a Branch in SourceTree it's not created in the connected online Bitbucket repository, this requires to go to the web site, create a Branch with the same name and in SourceTree to let push to this new remote Branch.

Adding a checkbox when creating a Branch in Sourcetree to let user decide if create it too inside the remote account should be the best way.

best regards.
fields.summary: When creating a branch from SourceTree (Win & Mac) it doesn't create it remotely in BitBucket too.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 # Open "Железнодорожные билеты" application
 # Tap on a "hamburger" menu in the top left corner of the screen
 # Select "Поддержка" section
 # Tap on the envelope icon

Expected result: we should see a list of applications that we can use for sending emails.

Actual result: we see a list of applications that also includes the apps which can't send emails.
fields.summary: Support menu: wrong applications are shown when trying to contact support via Email

fields.description:
When adding a GitLab Enterprise account, Sourcetree asks for a Username and Password.

 

It actually wants the Name (of the personal access token) and the Personal Access Token itself.

 

!image-2019-11-19-14-22-32-180.png!
fields.summary: GitLab Add Account via Personal Access Tokens asks for wrong information

fields.description:
Each time Sourcetree is started an "authenticate" dialog is displayed. 

Regardless whether I enter the credentials for an Bitbucket account and have [X]save in keychain selected, the dialog appears on the next launch
fields.summary: "Authenticate" dialog on each launch

fields.description:
After upgrading to 4.0 (232) everything was very sluggish — repository windows were slow to open and practically _any_ interaction with the UI caused a beachball of several seconds, even just typing in the commit message box. The issue made the app unusable.

Relaunching provided no improvement, so I reverted to version 4.0 (229) and the problem went away. It's surprising that a version bump this minor should cause such a dramatic performance hit. I suspect something is now running on the UI thread that used to run in worker thread.

Repro steps:

On MacOS Mojave (10.14.6), upgrade from Sourcetree 4.0 (229) to 4.0 (232) and relaunch. Observe unresponsiveness affecting all aspects of the UI.
fields.summary: V4.0 (232) UI unresponsive
Create push request on Azure DevOps does not work

fields.description: Ever since version 3.x, I've been annoyed with the increased spacing between table rows in History View. I still prefer v2.5.3, largely for this reason. I'm sure some people prefer the large spacing, so I'd be open to an option for a more condensed view. Information density is very important to me, especially on a large monitor.
fields.summary: History View: Row spacing is too large, space is wasted in commit table

fields.description:
SourceTree already includes the ability to Show/Hide Remote Branches. I'd like the same ability for tags. Many repositories I use have a ton of tags from automated submissions. Often there are 3 or more tag/branch tokens on a line, and they obscure commit messages.

I would prefer this to be a checkbox, rather than a popup. See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREE-7000 for reference.
fields.summary: History View: Add checkbox to show/hide tags

fields.description:
In the History View, I frequently get annoyed by using a popup to toggle between "Show Remote Branches" and "Hide Remote Branches". It's a binary selection, please use a checkbox instead.

I would also prefer if it were moved to the right of the "Date/Ancestor Order" popup.
fields.summary: History View: Change "Show/Hide Remote Branches" popup to a checkbox

fields.description: "Blame" is the git command users look for in user interfaces.  When looking for help on the internet, "blame" is the command they will find.  Not, "Annotate."
fields.summary: Replace "Annotate" with "Blame"

fields.description:
When examining the contents of git commits, running "Log Selected..." on files with names that begin with a period results in a dialog box with the following error:

 

*Potential security issue detected in the specified URL.*

Sourcetree determined this URL is in an unsupported format.

 

To reproduce, select a git commit that contains a file with a name beginning with a period (e.g. ".gitignore"), right-click on that file and select "Log Selected...".

Spotted in SourceTree for Mac 2.7 (152), but this may affect other versions.
fields.summary: "Log Selected" on files beginning with . results in unsupported URL format error

fields.description: I renamed the app "SourceTree 4.app", and initializing git-flow reported getopt errors. It seems to choke on the space in the name, and changing it back to "SourceTree.app" resolved it.
fields.summary: Renaming the app causes git-flow errors

fields.description: Previously, if there was a link in the commit text, for example by using Commit Text Replacement to replace Jira tickets IDs with links to the Jira project, it would open that link in a browser. Now, it just opens it in the same window, with the message "You should enable JavaScript to work with this page."
fields.summary: Clicking a link in the commit text window does not open browser

fields.description:
After testing the new Dark Theme I wanted to go back to the Light theme. 

Unfortunately switching back to the Light theme doesn't work (both from Settings and from the View->Appearance menu). The UI stays always in the Dark Theme for me.
fields.summary: Light/Dark Theme switching not working

fields.description:
Hello Team,

I created my bitbucket account and tried to log in the source tree directly. What i found there was i was not able to commit because source took my username as the one specified in text field instead of the unique username specified. Because of this source tree was not able to identify the corresponding account.

This issue can be in the communication between bitbucket and source tree when passing the user account details.

Note : I downloaded latest version from internet.
fields.summary: Consuming incorrect username

fields.description:
My sourcetree is having CPU issues. I'm using the latest version (4.0 232) and am constantly having to restart is due to it draining my laptop battery. It starts off fine, but then increases in CPU usage, often being the top user of CPU, around 86%. I'm on a MacBook pro, 10.14, 16GB memory,  2,8 GHz Quad-Core Intel Core i7.

I have a screen shot of it, [on dropbox|https://www.dropbox.com/s/29h4l6oks2tqxj7/sourcetree%20screenshot.png?dl=0]
fields.summary: Performance issues on Mac Catalina

fields.description:
Tap the terminal button on Toolbar, a window appears and says _There was a problem opening this repository in iTerm2_. Same result if I switch my preferred terminal to Terminal.app.

It occurs when I'm using a clean installed macOS 10.15.1, but it works well on my updated-from-mojave Catalina, which has Sourcetree installed before system upgrade.
fields.summary: Open in terminal failed

fields.description:
I'm trying to push and pull commits through SourceTree to the repository "crm-emails", associated with my organization, Betterment. Every time I try to push OR pull, I get the error "remote: Repository not found.
fatal: repository '[https://github.com/Betterment/crm-emails.git/]' not found".

I had my IT team check my permissions and I have full write access to the repository. I contacted Github, who gave me supposed instructions, but did not solve my issue. I am still getting the same issue.

I have relevant screenshots I can send as well in order to figure out why this is happening. Other members of the Marketing "team" that this repository is associated with have push and pull privileges with the same settings as my account.

Any ideas?
fields.summary: Repository not found

fields.description:
While configuring source tree, Unable to login to Atlassian Account

Error Message: Hmm... We're having trouble logging you in.

We're having trouble logging you in. There seems to be an issue with your identity 

provider. Wait a few moments, the try again.
fields.summary: Unable to configure source tree (version 2.6.3)

fields.description:
I have 256 stashes in a repository and unable to use each of them before creating 257th stash. Perhaps there is some downcast that lose information and use only the last byte to figure out if stashes list can be expanded.

Steps to reproduce:

* Open repository in SourceTree app
* Create stashes until you get 256
* Go to the left column of the repository window
* Scroll down to find "STASHES" section

I used "git stash list >> a.txt" and text editor with numerable lines to figure out amount of stashes.

Actual behavior:
"STASHES" section is collapsed and "Show" button in the section's header row is hidden.

Expected behavior:
"STASHES" section does not collapse automatically or at least "Show" button is not hidden and user is able to expand section.

Potential solution(I might be many times wrong):
Use direct comparison to "0" instead of forms like "if(count)"/"(bool)count"/"bool f = count;"/"bool checker(){return count;}". I'm not sure what language was used to perform such a "comparison" so syntax might be mistaken.

PS
I'm aware that my amount of stashes is excessive. And probably this is a good sign to cut all except few. Thanks for attention and have a good day =)

It didn't quite understand, what should I put into the "Component/s" field, but there was "Git" and I actually use it, so I Put it there. Let me know if any additional info required.
fields.summary: 256 Stashes are not displayed

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1) Do interactive rebase of a branch on top of another. The branch can have one commit, but should have merge conflicts.

2) Resolve merge conflicts manually.

3) Continue rebase.

Expected behavior:  Rebase completed

Actual behavior: Sourcetree action hangs. You must cancel the action in the UI. See screenshot below.

Workaround: Quit Sourcetree, reopen it, and the 'Continue' works fine as expected.

Extra notes: This bug has existed for years, dating back to old versions of Sourcetree For Mac. It occurs 100% of the time for the repro steps. I have seen it on multiple computers, with different login accounts, and different repositories and upstream git repos.

 

!image-2019-11-10-06-17-18-360.png!
fields.summary: 'Continue' rebase after conflict hangs

fields.description: Test
fields.summary: Test

fields.description:
Hello, I upgraded my macOS box to Catalina and then tried to download and run Sourcetree for the first time on this machine. I get the below error when trying to run the app.

 

*“Sourcetree” can’t be opened because Apple cannot check it for malicious software.*

*This software needs to be updated. Contact the developer for more information.*

 

Other users are hitting the same issue: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Cannot-open-Soucetree-on-Catalina/qaq-p/1219213?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_answer&utm_content=topic]
fields.summary: Unable to open Sourcetree on Catalina after install

fields.description: When viewing big files with many changes the internal diff tool will lag to the point where sometimes Sourcetree will crash. Even when the max file count option is put to 1. It really needs optimization
fields.summary: Optimize internal diff tool
history view doesn't display text after comma

fields.description: The registration link does not work on Sourcetree 2.1 for Mac. The browser will return a 404 error. Without registration, Sourcetree 2.1 cannot be used for more than 30 days. Since Sourcetree 2.1 is the highest version that support MacOS X 10.9.5, and there are plenty of old Macs that cannot upgrade to a later version of macOS.
fields.summary: Registration link does not work on Sourcetree 2.1 for Mac

fields.description: Updated tonight to 4.0 (232) on Catalina and its not tracking changes without a restart, I have had to restart twice tonight to commit code.
fields.summary: Not Tracking Changes unless restart

fields.description: The download package was infected by a virus and was picked up and quarantined by my McAfee LiveSafe.. The virus was named Artemis
fields.summary: downloading sourcetree introduces a virus

fields.description:
When I open a submodule from a parent by double-clicking, it opens in a new window.

The title at the top of the submodule's window is set to one of two things:
 * the full path to the submodule
 * The one-word submodule name that appears in the SourceTree submodules sidebar

This behavior is unpredictable and perhaps random.

Ideally it would be configurable by the user. My preference is to display the short submodule names because they fit better in tabs, but I'd imagine there are users who may prefer to display the full path.
fields.summary: When opening a submodule from a parent, the submodule window title unpredictably shows either the submodule's full path or the short submodule name

fields.description: Text replacement links in v4.0 do not open in the browser, they display in the commit info section (i.e. where the commit message is displayed along with the SHA, Parents, Author, Date, and Labels) where they appear.  That is, clicking the link directs the commit info section to the target of the link as a small browser rather than opening the link externally.
fields.summary: Text replacement links do not open in the browser

fields.description:
In the latest Sourcetree 4.0 (232) on Catalina, beginning a drag on any file in the pending files pane when on "Uncommited changes" instantly crashes sourcetree. I can reproduce this on at least 2 separate machines.

The following is the core dump:
{code:java}
Exception Type: EXC_BAD_INSTRUCTION (SIGILL)
 Exception Codes: 0x0000000000000001, 0x0000000000000000
 Exception Note: EXC_CORPSE_NOTIFY
Termination Signal: Illegal instruction: 4
 Termination Reason: Namespace SIGNAL, Code 0x4
 Terminating Process: exc handler [81866]
Application Specific Information:
 Crashing on exception: There are 2 items on the pasteboard, but 1 drag images. There must be 1 draggingItem per pasteboardItem.
Application Specific Backtrace 1:
 0 CoreFoundation 0x00007fff2ed0b783 __exceptionPreprocess + 250
 1 libobjc.A.dylib 0x00007fff64cb78f3 objc_exception_throw + 48
 2 CoreFoundation 0x00007fff2ed0b5d9 +[NSException raise:format:] + 181
 3 AppKit 0x00007fff2c1a127b -[NSDraggingSession(NSInternal) _initWithPasteboard:image:offset:source:] + 247
 4 AppKit 0x00007fff2c1a0cae -[NSCoreDragManager dragImage:fromWindow:at:offset:event:pasteboard:source:slideBack:] + 1889
 5 AppKit 0x00007fff2c1a053d -[NSWindow(NSDrag) dragImage:at:offset:event:pasteboard:source:slideBack:] + 134
 6 AppKit 0x00007fff2c5247d1 -[NSOutlineView dragImage:at:offset:event:pasteboard:source:slideBack:] + 198
 7 AppKit 0x00007fff2c62426d -[NSTableView _doImageDragUsingRowsWithIndexes:event:pasteboard:source:slideBack:startRow:] + 656
 8 AppKit 0x00007fff2c624700 -[NSTableView __doImageDragUsingRowsWithIndexes:event:pasteboard:source:slideBack:startRow:] + 276
 9 AppKit 0x00007fff2c62540a -[NSTableView _performClassicDragOfIndexes:hitRow:event:] + 452
 10 AppKit 0x00007fff2c1cb63e -[NSTableView _performDragFromMouseDown:] + 472
 11 AppKit 0x00007fff2c1c9ac3 -[NSTableView mouseDown:] + 754
 12 AppKit 0x00007fff2c1c95de -[NSOutlineView mouseDown:] + 73
 13 AppKit 0x00007fff2c0707f9 -[NSWindow(NSEventRouting) _handleMouseDownEvent:isDelayedEvent:] + 4907
 14 AppKit 0x00007fff2bfb3e80 -[NSWindow(NSEventRouting) _reallySendEvent:isDelayedEvent:] + 2612
 15 AppKit 0x00007fff2bfb320d -[NSWindow(NSEventRouting) sendEvent:] + 349
 16 AppKit 0x00007fff2be76618 -[NSApplication(NSEvent) sendEvent:] + 352
 17 AppKit 0x00007fff2be66005 -[NSApplication run] + 707
 18 AppKit 0x00007fff2be57e7d NSApplicationMain + 777
 19 libdyld.dylib 0x00007fff6600a405 start + 1
 20 ??? 0x0000000000000002 0x0 + 2
{code}
fields.summary: Dragging a file in the pending file pane instantly crashes Sourcetree 4.0

fields.description:
In the "Confirm Merge" Dialog, add an option to Skip CI.

!image-2019-11-04-10-53-58-505.png!
fields.summary: Add UI Option to Skip CI when merging branches

fields.description:
More general name of the issue is: "Make SourceTree laptop screen friendly".

Currently Workspace options are displayed in the left side bar. I switch between the File status and History a lot, and I'd say those two are the most clicked elements in the UI for me (do you have insight into which buttons are actually being used and which are not?).

I rarely need/use the Braches list.

The problem is when working on a small screen like a 13 inch laptop, in order to switch between the History and File status, I need the side bar to be open, which reduces the screen estate.

Can you please make it possible to display the Workspace options in the main top bar?
fields.summary: Show Workspace options in the main top bar

fields.description:
I can't go back from dark theme to light. When I select a light theme in the preferences it gets selected but the actual theme doesn't change.

So the setting show "Light" as selected, but the UI is dark.
fields.summary: Dark theme won't change back

fields.description: I am using evolve extension with Mercurial but that confuses sourcetree. It would be nice to see that extension supported. I am not talking about being able to do what evolve allows you to do but at least support the fact that there could be obsolete changeset in the history.
fields.summary: Support Mercurial Evolve extensions (Obsolete/hidden Changesets)

fields.description: Getting a message saying my Bitbucket Cloud acct isn't configured to that Atlassian acct yet it is. Can't proceed with source tree installer.
fields.summary: Can't install Sourcetree on Mac High Sierra

fields.description:
Few Anti-Virus 8/59 detected SourceTree as Adware/PUA

[https://www.virustotal.com/gui/file/9ec65e251f67204cb3f6be265e6791ea34f96ded942d9c82c76529c46551faed/detection]
fields.summary: SourceTree Mac detected as Malware

fields.description: I upgraded my Mac to 10.15.1 yesterday and now Sourcetree won't start. '"Sourcetree.app" can't be opened because Apple cannot check it for malicious software'
fields.summary: Mac 10.15.1 incompatible with Soutretree

fields.description:
Whenever I open a repository window SourceTree ends up running at 100%+ CPU and stays that way until I force close it. Closing all the repository windows does nothing.

 

I am running version 4.0(232) on Mac OSX version 10.14.6.

This has been happening for a while now in older versions too.
fields.summary: Runs at 100% CPU

fields.description:
The problem is that when user download the Sourcetree app for mac it's detected as adware.

Please see screenshot attached.
fields.summary: Sourcetree app for mac is detected as adware

fields.description:
It would be very convenient if you could see in the Window (drop-down) menu which open repositories have changes that can be pulled and/or pushed.

This should be possible with a small icon next to the repository name. It is like the bullet that some applications show in the Windows menu when you have unchanged changes in that open document.
fields.summary: Show remote repo status in Window menu

fields.description: I am a new user who just started to use sourcetree with github. I notice that upon creating a new repository, there is no scroll bar so i can see the create button. please fix this. It confused me and I thought sourcetree had a problem.
fields.summary: Bad design when creating new repositories

fields.description:
Previously sourcetree was able to clone private repos with ssh but all of a sudden started runn ing into permission issues after the catalina upgrade nothing has changed in the connection, the Bitbucket account is connected  and the repos are searchable 

 

 

!image-2019-10-29-07-09-04-502.png!
fields.summary: sourcetree cannot clone repos with ssh as it runs into permission denied

fields.description:
I get the following message when trying to sign in:

Confirm access to your account
Invalid client_id

This integration is misconfigured. Contact the vendor for assistance.
fields.summary: Unable to display remote repositories in SourceTree

fields.description:
Sourcetree 4.0 comes with the following changes
{quote}*Changes*

*macOS Dark Mode*

Choose from automatic, light, or dark at a click

Replaces the previous custom Atlassian dark theme
{quote}
With all due respect, these two changes are broken.

Previous Atlassian dark theme was better in the sense of better colour contrast.

The transparency of the sidebar doesn't play well with the number of commits ahead/behind.

 

Also, I cannot switch between Light/Dark theme. Now it's only Dark.

PS:" Sourcetree 4.0 - Major Release [22 October 2019]" is not part of the "Affects Version" list
fields.summary: Version 4.0 breaking Dark Mode switching
Cannot download sourcetree version 4.0

fields.description: Check for updates shows version 4 availability although neither blog or site have it, and Install button shows error about not being able to unzip update.
fields.summary: Check for updates shows version 4 availability

fields.description:
I recently updated.  Now that I look at the version it is showing version 4.0. 

I open sourcetree on any repository. With a file listed in the unstaged file I start to drag it to the staged area. Immediately Sourcetree crashes.  

This is fully repeatable.
fields.summary: Dragging unstaged file creashes Sourcetree - Version 4.0

fields.description:
In Preferences > General > Miscellaneous, when changing from *Light Mode* or *Dark Mode* to *Use macOS system appearance*, Sourcetree gets stuck on that setting even if you change back to manually setting Light or Dark mode.

I've tested on macOS Mojave v10.14.0 through to v10.14.4
fields.summary: Sourcetree ignores Appearance setting

fields.description:
After upgrading to Sourcetree 4.0 Mac, Bitdefender reports:

An infected file attempted to run on your device.

Threat name: Adware.MAC.Generic.14423

Path: /Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/MacOS/Sourcetree

We deleted the file to prevent malicious commands from being executed on your device.
fields.summary: Bitdefender Antivirus reports Sourcetree as Adware

fields.description:
Crash occurs when dragging from any list that supports drag/drop.
macOS Catalina 10.15

First noticed when trying to see if I could re-order my git repo list.

Application Specific Information:
Crashing on exception: There are 2 items on the pasteboard, but 1 drag images. There must be 1 draggingItem per pasteboardItem.
fields.summary: Crash when dragging from any list

this is what it states in Eclipse when I try to clone a repository from Artemis:

fields.description:
Sourcetree crashes when try dragging file between staged and unstaged views. 
This issue appeared after the last update
fields.summary: Crash when dragging fils.

fields.description: In the preview window, where you can select your local/remote repos, if you *long press* any repo and *move* you *mouse* a bit, the app *crashes* really hard.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes on Longpress + Mousemove

fields.description: Version 4.0 introduced additional padding to the bottom of the line for text in the diff view. I'm running Sourcetree v4.0 (229) on macOS Catalina 10.15 (19A602). See screenshot here: https://imgur.com/AIvxk0i
fields.summary: Extra line bottom padding in diff view

fields.description: It is impossible to return to Light Mode. The app stays in Dark Mode regarding of the setting which has been set to Light Mode.
fields.summary: Light mode not working

fields.description: Since a recent update, pressing Cmd+Shift+C does still open the commit view and expand the comment field, but the curser focus is not set anymore into that field.
fields.summary: Regression: Cmd+Shift+C does not place the cursor in the commit field anymore

fields.description:
It always says:



fatal: could not read Password for 'https://USERNAME@bitbucket.org': Device not configured

Fatal: Could not fetch FEATURE/HOTFIX from origin.

=> I have this problem sins several versions, non of the fixes out of the threads in the community board are working...
I've deleted the repo and cloned it again, I've deleted the account and reconnect it, I've deleted all Bitbucket passwords from keychain and I checked the origins url and added the username... 
Nothing works, it used to work well, then it sometimes work with some repos and with other not and no it seemed to not work at all anymore, so annoying, source tree is unusable on Mac this way! The Problem is there since 2018!?
fields.summary: Gitflow can't be used on Mac os

fields.description:
I have a .gitattributes file with the following content:
{code:none}
* binary
*.py text=auto eol=lf
*.html text=auto eol=lf
*.css text=auto eol=lf
*.scss text=auto eol=lf
*.txt text=auto eol=lf
*.md text=auto eol=lf
*.sh text=auto eol=lf
*.wsgi text=auto eol=lf
*.conf text=auto eol=lf
*.ini text=auto eol=lf
*.js text=auto eol=lf
*.jsx text=auto eol=lf
*.json text=auto eol=lf
*.po text=auto eol=lf
*.yaml text=auto eol=lf
*.yml text=auto eol=lf
{code}
 

The file treatment here defaults to binary files, but each text file is excluded.

 

Unfortunately, SourceTree now treats all text files as binary files in the diff preview.
fields.summary: .gitattributes file is handled incorrectly
